flawed_nl_solution:
The price per 500 mL milk from the 2 packs is $2.5/2 = $<<2.5/2=1.04>>1.04.
This means that for each pack of 500 mL milk, you can save $1.3 - $1.04 = $0.26.
Ten sets of 2 packs mean 10 x 2 = <<10*2=20>>20 packs of 500 mL of milk.
So, your total savings will be $0.26 x 20 = $<<0.26*20=5.29>>5.29.
